channel.title: Where to start
channel.description:
Ok, so i know the basics of java, and GUI's and stuff, but i have no clue where to start for making custom clients and stuff for java.
If anyone could point me where to look, what to learn, and what everything means, please do..

item.title: Where to start
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

yakman:

[quote author=Exception link=topic=217272.msg1890902#msg1890902 date=1195719384]Also, download popcorn’s deober, and play around with the deob on an expendable account.

IMO this is what you should do first,
theres two big things you would need to learn, they are about the client, and bytecode engineering

learn a bit about the client first, then bytecode after,
also search this forum for other thread similar to this, like “how do i start with the client” or something (like my own thread like this is here)[/quote]
Yer,
learn java,
mess with a deobfuscated client,
learn bytecode,
then play with bots and updaters.

Read full topic

item.title: Where to start
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Exception:

Also, download popcorn’s deober, and play around with the deob on an expendable account.

IMO this is what you should do first,
theres two big things you would need to learn, they are about the client, and bytecode engineering

learn a bit about the client first, then bytecode after,
also search this forum for other thread similar to this, like “how do i start with the client” or something (like my own thread like this is here)

Read full topic

item.title: Where to start
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

Look at the BCEL tutorials in the Java Programming section. They are stickied. Grab an bot (like ares), and start seeing how it works. Also, download popcorn’s deober, and play around with the deob on an expendable account.

Read full topic
